When it comes to the discussion about marriage amongst young people, there are those for and those against getting married; While some feel happy unmarried due to various reasons, others prefer living together as couple without going through the "rigour" of marriage. This and much more form the topic of discussion on the relationship show, Odo Mu Nsem this week.

Join this conversation on GhanaTalksRadio! As a couple do you prefer cohabiting unmarried or married?
Not everyone needs to have sex in order to have a healthy and happy relationship but some people do. Join the conversation via www.ghanatalksradio.com as we gist you more on life story.
We explore the concept of submission in marriage and discuss the importance of balancing it with equality and mutual respect. To what extent should a wife be submissive to her husband?

Do you suspect your relationship is in trouble, but you're not sure? This video will help you identify the signs of a failing relationship, such as constant bickering and feeling emotionally disconnected. We'll also offer insights into how to communicate effectively and reignite the passion in your relationship.

In today's digital age, many couples are choosing to record their intimate and romantic moments. But is it really a good idea? Today, we explore the pros and cons of letting your partner record your private moments. From the potential risks of the footage being leaked online to the benefits of capturing memories, we delve into the debate surrounding this controversial topic. Join us for an insightful discussion on whether you should allow your partner to record your intimate moments.

Relationships can be wonderful, but they can also be challenging at times. In this video, we explore the best ways to handle tough times in a relationship, including effective communication strategies, problem-solving techniques, and building a strong foundation of trust and respect. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

In this video, we delve into the age-old question of whether or not it's okay for your partner to have friends of the opposite sex. We'll explore various viewpoints on this topic, ranging from the belief that it's essential for partners to have their own social lives to the concern that such friendships can lead to infidelity or emotional affairs.  Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Trust is key in each relationship. So as privacy. What are the boundaries that are appropriate for a lasting relationship when it comes to trust and privacy.  DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude discuss on Odo Mu Nsem.  Would you allow your partner to answer your call or go through your chats?   Join the conversation on Odo Mu Nsem. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Romance and intimacy are integral to lasting relationships. Most people actually marry to satisfy sexual desires. But there are others who have quite extremely sexual fantasies. Would you marry a sex addict? Join the conversation on Odo Mu Nsem. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Today on Odo Mu Nsem we discuss whether it is appropriate or not for a wife to allow her sister-in-law to wear her husband’s clothes. What are your thoughts? Share with us in the comments section. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Most lovers dream of the perfect weddings and marriage life. They are beautiful aren’t they? Marriages are not always rosy actually. A lot of couples do not understand why they find it difficult to be happy with their spouses. Join the discussion with DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude on Odo Mu Nsem.  Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

They say love can be found everywhere .. but including a dating site? What are the chances of finding true love on an app, especially in these times? DJ Charm is joined by Ohemaa Trimude and a panel to discuss this issue. What are your thoughts? Share with us in the comments section. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

They say love knows no bounds.. but Can an adopted son fall in love with the biological daughter of his foster parents? DJ Charm is joined by Ohemaa Trimude and a panel to discuss this issue. What are your thoughts? Share with us in the comments section. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Communication is very important for sustaining a relationship. But keeping a good communication level is not quite easy. How do partners get to maintain healthy communication in a relationship? We discuss this on Odo Mu Nsem. Visit ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows

Every couple love to stay together at all times. Yet for come couples, they get to see each other scarcely due to work travel. On Odo Mu Nsem, we discuss how spouses react or would feel when their partners have to be away at work for three weeks out of the four weeks in a month. Visit ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

Being in a relationship is a source of happiness for a lot of people. Similarly, pain is derived from the same source. With a lot of uncertainties, it's easier for fears to be nurtured by partners in a romantic relationship or marriage. What is your biggest fear about being in a relationship? On Odo Mu Nsem, DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude are joined by a panel to discuss this important topic. Visit ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

How far can you go for the one you love? Can anything you do because of love include even vomiting a sin? We look at a holy Christian lady who accepts a condition of a man to have sex with him before accepting to become a Christian. This lead to a relationship between the two. Do you think she committed a sin?

Discovering that your partner is gay or lesbian can be a difficult and confusing experience. It can come as a surprise and leave you wondering how to navigate this new reality. In this video, we'll be discussing the challenges and opportunities that come with a surprise coming out, and providing tips on how to process and deal with the news. Our goal is to create a safe space where people can find understanding and guidance in dealing with this difficult situation.

Everyone loves a gift, especially when it’s from the people we love the most. Whereas a husband may give his wife a gift for many reasons, should he have a say in what his wife does with the gift? Is It Advisable for a Wife to Sell Gifts She Received from her Husband? Join the discussion on Odo Mu Nsem live on GhanaTalksRadio.

Dating oftentimes leads to marriage. Sometimes too that is not the case. Whiles there is not specific timeline for how long two people can date each other, there’s usually an uncertainty or anxiety in the process. How long should a guy date a lady before proposing marriage to her? Join the discussion on Odo Mu Nsem live on GhanaTalksRadio.

A man spending money on his partner can be very controversial, especially in these days. Should a guy be responsible for the financial needs of his girlfriend? The team discusses this interesting topic on the Odo Mu Nsem Show live on Ghanatalksradio.

The decision to search for love again after a failed relationship can be a very difficult one to come by. It is easier to give up on life in such circumstances. Some people do. But for anyone who wants to give life a go again, how long should they wait before seeking love again? Share your thoughts with us.

Cheating is one of the breakers for a lot of people in relationships. Whiles a lot of people do cheat, no one wants to be cheated on. Is it appropriate to confess to your partner that you cheated on them?

Keeping secrets in a relationship can have very adverse effects on the harmony of the relationship. Another important element is how a partner reacts after finding out a secret. What would you do if you find yourself in a situation like this?

It is no secret that whereas some mothers-in-law have very harmonious relationships with the wives of their sons, a lot more usually have a sour relationship with thee daughters-in-law. 

What could be the cause? Our panel discuss this on Odo Mu Nsem live on GhanaTalksRadio.

Would you date your friend's ex?

Let us know in the comments section.

#GhanaTalksRadio
#OdoMuNsem

Sustaining a health marriage is very difficult especially in these times. What are some of the factors that help a marriage last? Could it be love, sex, or just money? DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude are joined by our panel to discuss this important topic.

Relationships work best when the two partners are both fully involved and committed. However that is not the case always. What are some of the signs that show that your partner is losing interest in you? DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude bring to you a lively discussion on the topic.

Infidelity is the cause of the breakdown of a lot of marriages. What are some of the signs of a cheating spouse? Our panelists share their though on this very important issue. Watch, share, like and leave a comment.

Polygamy has been a part and parcel of the African culture. As much as that is the case, a lot of Africans have reservations about this African norm. Could it be a result of westernization?

DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude are joined by a panel to discuss this interesting topic. Leave a comment!

Living with your parents can be such a thrill. But is this the same case when you are married or when any of your parents lives with you and your spouse in your matrimonial home? On this edition of Odo Mu Nsem, our panel share their insights on how sharing a matrimonial home with your parent could affect your marriage.

Getting into a relationship or not is one of the key decision almost everyone has to make at one point in their life. As such, much thought is needed on the decision. How would you know what time is the best to start a relationship?

Affection is the spice of every love relationship. It is the little touches and kisses that bring the most fun and joyful moments.

Should you be concerned when your partner begins to hold back their affection in your love life? Join the conversation on Odu Mu Nsem with DJ Charm and Ohemaa Trimude. Share your thoughts with us as well during the live show on Thursday at 8pm.

As we observe the Ghana heritage month in March, Koo Ntakra explains some of the rights and responsibilities of citizens of Ghana. Do you know what rights you have? Share your thoughts with us in the comments section. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Widowhood rites are performed by many ethic groups in Ghana and for many reasons. Whereas some have been criticized, some have been encouraged. What are they and why are they performed? Share your thoughts. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

African traditional beliefs have been relegated to the background and labeled archaic in recent times. But should that be the case? The Kente is one of the most known and admired traditional Ghanaian cloth and fabric. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Marriage is a form of culture. Each culture has its own rites of marriage, even though some of common among different ethnic groups. Koo Ntakra discusses some peculiar rituals reserved in the Akan Culture. What is Asiwa Ware? Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Most people pray everyday. Meditation is also becoming more and more fashionable. Have we stopped to ponder why these two acts have been significant to the lives of many? Koo Ntakra discusses the significance of prayers and meditation. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

Musicians are quick to rise to fame and the limelight. But most often, the career and fame of musicians quickly decline. What could be some of the contributory factors? Koo Ntakra is joined by King Gastor to discuss this phenomenon.. visit http://www.ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

Things one can use to pour libation

Benefits of pouring libation 

‐For protection

In a shocking turn of events, the headmaster of Ghana Senior High School (Ghanasco) has stepped aside following a viral video that showed students using a toilet facility as a dormitory. The video, which sparked outrage on social media, prompted the Ghana Education Service to ask the headmaster of the school to step aside.

In this video, we discuss the recent war remarks made by Bryan Acheampong that have sparked a response from the National Democratic Congress (NDC), leading to potential trouble for Ghana ahead of the 2024 General Elections. We provide an analysis of the situation and offer insights into the potential implications. Don't miss this crucial update on Ghana's political landscape.

Join us for a thought-provoking discussion on the changing roles of men in modern relationships. From communication and intimacy to commitment and family life, we'll explore how men are adapting to meet the demands of today's world.

Are you looking to live a more fulfilling life? In this video, we'll share tips on how to make the most out of your life. From setting goals and cultivating meaningful relationships to pursuing your passions and taking care of your health, these tips will help you live with purpose and fulfillment. Watch now and start living the life you want today!

Frank Lampard has been named as the interim manager for Chelsea following the sacking of Graham Potter. In addition, Real Madrid beats Barca at Camp Nou to progress to the Copa Del Rey final. Liverpool is set to host Arsenal in an exciting Premier League clash. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Struggling with self-love and acceptance can be tough, but it's an important part of our mental and emotional well-being. In today’s episode, we explore simple steps for practicing self-love and acceptance, including positive self-talk, self-care practices, and building a support system. By prioritizing our relationship with ourselves, we can improve our confidence, resilience, and overall quality of life.

Ghana’s Parliament passed new revenue bills after a close margin vote. The taxes are part of the constitutionality for securing a 3 billion dollar IMF deal. Both NPP MPs and NDC MPs stuck to their positions in the vote. We review what this means for Ghanaians who are already burdened with a high cost of living.

We take a close look at Ernest Nuamah and Fatawa Issahaku - their talents and potential. Also, we preview English Premier League matches this weekend; especially the match between Manchester City v Liverpool as well as Arsenal v Leeds. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Conversations of the Bill to criminalize LGBTQ activities in Ghana have risen following comments made by US Vice President Kamala Harris during her visit to the country. President Akuffo Adoo’s response on the status of the bill also raised a lot of eyebrows. Finally, Speaker of Parliament, Alban Bagbin made emphatic statements that the bill will be passed. We review these on the Cubicle. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

In this video, we delve into the concept of self-development and why it can be challenging for many people. Self-development refers to the conscious effort of improving oneself, both personally and professionally, through identifying strengths and weaknesses, setting goals, and taking action to achieve those goals.
We are discussing the NDC losing a vote to approve ministerial nominees of President Akuffo Adoo. Following the resignation of some ministers, a few were nominated to fill in the vacancies.

Ghana Black Stars face Angola in AFCON 2023 qualifier in Kumasi. We preview the match live on the Cubicle. Make the right predictions to stand a chance to win ghc20. Visit ghanatalksradio for more of our shows.

In this video, we will be discussing an important topic that concerns us all - how to make the most of our time and energy. With so many demands on our time, it can be difficult to know where to focus our efforts and how to stay productive without burning out. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

We discuss the pronouncements of President Akufo Addo on the potential date for the finalization of the three billion dollar IMF deal that the country has signed up for. There have been changing deadlines? But recently, the President has been certain about a March deadline. Is this realistic? Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

The final funeral rite for Christian Atsu is held at the State House. Special Tributes from wife, children, Wakaso, Asamoah Gyan, and other colleagues pour in for the Christian Atsu. What would you remember Christian Atsu for? Share with us in the comments section.

Chris Hughton faces first test as Black Stars coach in AFCON qualifier against Angola at the Baba Yara sports stadium. Fans ready for UCL quarterfinal draw as Chelsea, Napoli secure wins. NPP flag bearer hopeful, Mr. Alan Kyeremanten says Ghana needs a transformational leader and he is the one. Also, Ghanaians to resume paying road tolls at higher cost soon following u-turn by ministry. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

There’s a growing narrative that men are becoming less of the natural depiction of men. Men are becoming less masculine and have become weaker. How true is that narrative? Seidu Iddrisu joins Lansah Lawrence on the Cubicle to asses this. Share your thoughts with us. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

In times where everything goes, the youth are not particular about the numerous people they have sexual relations with. A lot have multiple sex partners. Is safety a thing of the past? We discuss the Cubicle. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Ghana celebrates 66 years after gaining independence from the British in March, 1957. Kwame Nkrumah gave the independence speech on the 6th of March, 1957. We look again at the speech of the First President of Ghana. We also explore its significance to the Ghana we have today. Vist ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Ten Hag leads Manchester United to Carabao Cup glory. Arsenal maintain a five-point lead over Manchester City after defeating Everton. Meanwhile Liverpool will clash with Manchester United at Old Trafford on Sunday in the English Premier League. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Bola Ahmad Tinubu has been announced as president-elect by INEC. John Mahama announces a comeback while Jean Mensah defends Ghana Card as the best way to protect integrity. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Is it necessary to celebrate your achievements? Are we not jumping the gun and celebrating mediocrity or little achievements? Does it harm or it’s good for keeping up morale? Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more shows.

Humans are social beings who need specific rules for social interaction in order to maintain interpersonal relationships. Even if social etiquette seems like an endless list of unnecessary rules, it is beneficial for everyone to follow such etiquette. What are some social etiquettes you follow? Share your thoughts with us. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Real Madrid come-from-behind 5-2 win over Liverpool in their UCL round-of-16 first leg at Anfield. Meanwhile, Manchester City drew at Leipzig. Also, Barcelona plays the 2nd leg match with Manchester United at Old Trafford in Europa league play-offs. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Discussing John Mahama’s intent to contest for presidency in 2024, Alan Cash promises to bring economy back to life and Ato Forson grilling KT Hammond, Stephen Amoah and Others at Vetting. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Higher education has been equated to achieving success. But is that still the case in modern times? Today we look at the benefits and disadvantages of pursuing higher education in Ghana. Share your thoughts with us in the comments section. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Are you confused about the difference between coaching and mentorship? In this video, we break down the key distinctions between these two terms and explore their unique benefits. Coaching typically involves a specific set of skills or goals, while mentorship focuses on long-term personal and professional development. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Lim Jo joins Lansah Lawrence on the Cubicle to review the EPL clash between the Gunners and Manchester City. City climbed to the top of the table by beating Arsenal 3-1 at the Emirates. Meanwhile, Chelsea Fc loses the first-leg fixture by a lone goal at the Signal Iduna Park. Also, Manchester United travel to the Camp Nou for Europa league play-off against Barcelona. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Police arrest 18 people from the Commonwealth Hall in the University of Ghana following demonstrations against school authorities relating to accommodation for continuing students. Attorney General closes case against Ato Forson, court to resume on March 30. What do you make of these stories? Share your thoughts with us. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more updates.

The #FearWomen always pops up on trends on social media. A lot of posts are made to justify why young men are advised to fear women especially when it comes to relationships. How valid is this trend and what causes it? Share your thoughts with us. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Mentorship is a relationship between a more experienced or knowledgeable person (mentor) and a less experienced or knowledgeable person (mentee) in which the mentor provides guidance, advice, and support to help the mentee develop their skills, knowledge, and career. What are your experiences with a mentor? Share with us. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

We are discussing the Lebron James points record in the NBA, the punishment Manchester City risk, and the dire situation confronting Christian Atsu. Share your thoughts with us in the comments section. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Ato Forson gave his first speech as Minority Leader in Parliament after he took over from Haruna Iddrisu. Meanwhile, KT Hammond, Bryan Acheampong, and others were nominated for ministerial positions. The Domestic Debt Exchange Program is being implemented. These and more on the Cubicle. Vist ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

Advising a friend can be really difficult. You don’t know how they would take it. This has led to many people losing their friends to bad habits. Stigmatization also builds in such circumstances. We discuss how to reach out to friends on the Cubicle. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.
Despite being in a global village, there is the need to preserve one’s culture. Today, many aspects of Ghana’s culture are lost on the youth. How does this affect our society and future?

Vice President Dr. Mahamud Bawumina leads the implementation of the National Rental Assistance Scheme to assist the youth to pay their rent. Visit ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy more of our shows.

The thought of giving up comes to mind every second especially when the going gets tougher. It is usual that a lot give in to the thought. But to succeed, one must keep the strive alive. What are the best ways to keep oneself motivated? We discuss on the Cubicle. Visit ghanatalksradio.con for more of our shows.

A lot of young people are traveling outside of Ghana. Blaming the lack of opportunities in the country, there's a lot of brain drain going on. Do you think this is justified? What are the best ways one can travel outside of Ghana and in what circumstances? We discuss this on the Cubicle. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

We look at the CHAN tournament where the Black Galaxies face Niger in the second stage of the competition. In England, specifically the Carabao Cup, Man Utd. beat Forest in first leg. Could they be winning first trophy since 2017 Meanwhile, Chelsea looks to add new signings before window closes. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

A lot of men are womanizers. They love to be known as playboys. It is almost normal for the average man to have multiple sex partners. What could be the reason? Is it ego thing, or they’re searching for true love? Share your thoughts with us on the Cubicle with Lansah Lawrence. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

Many personalities have always made a claim that the youth in Ghana are lazy. These are blamed for the poor state of the country and low productivity on the part of young people. Is this a valid claim? We discuss this on the Cubicle with Lansah Lawrence joined by Selina Owusu. Visit ghanatalksradio.com for more of our shows.

We look at what thi means for Erik Ten Hag’s team. Meanwhile the Gunners received booster with signing of Trossard from Brighton. Visit http://ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

Okudzeto Ablakwah drugs REv. Kusi to CHRAJ over National Cathedral money transfers. Meanwhile, Dag Heward Mills gives reasons for his resignation from the Board of Trustees. We discuss the revelations associated with the construction of the Cathedral in recent days live on www.ghanatalksradio.com

Buidling Self-confidence means   ’’you accept and trust yourself and have a sense of control in your life. You know your strengths and weakness well, and have a positive view of yourself. You set realistic expectations and goals, communicate assertively, and can handle criticism’’. We look at how it can help the young man on the Cubcile. Visit ghanatalksradio.com to enjoy our shows.

The Government has extended the deadline for its domestic debt exchange programme to January 31.

This is to deepen stakeholder engagement on the proposed policy. What could be the reason behind another failure on the part of the Ghana government to secure collaboation from stakeholder?

Manchester United host rivals Manchester City in the Manchester Derby on Saturday. With renewed force, does Ten Hag’ s Red Devils have what it takes to pip Pep Guardiola’s men? We look at the impact of Joao Felix signing for Chelsea and whether that will help turn things around for Graham Potter. Visit www.ghanatalksradio.com for the latest news and updates.

We explore the many benefits of mentorship and how it can help you achieve your goals. From gaining valuable insights and knowledge to expanding your network and receiving guidance and support, mentorship can play a crucial role in helping you reach your full potential. We discuss taking a closer look at the different types of mentorship, how to find the right mentor, and how to make the most of your mentorship relationship. Whether you're just starting out in your career or looking to make a change, this video will provide valuable insights to help you take the next step on your journey to success.

Whether you're a beginner or an experienced reader, these tips will help you make reading a part of your daily routine.

Lionel Messi wins the World Cup for Argentina in the 2022 FIFA World Cup. Ronaldo’s Portugual crushed out in the quarterfinals. Award-winning Poet, Ambitious the Poet reviews tracklist of his latest album the ‘ICONIC’ live on the Cubicle with Lansah Lawrence.

Bodybuilding and exercising come with a lot of health benefits for everyone engaged in it. Lansah Lawrence is joined by Seidu Iddris and Yakubu Sumaila on the Cubicle to answer the question. Join us.

Popularly knowns as General Mosquito, Mr. Asiedu Nketiah was elected National Chairman of the National Democratic Congress at the 10th Delegates Congress of the party. Among a new set of national executives elected, do you think his leadership will propel the NDC into power come January, 2025? Let us know your thoughts.

The 2023 Budget for Ghana as submitted by Finance Minister, Ken Ofori-Atta was passed by the House on Tuesday 6th December. With the Minority claiming the Budget was only passed in its principle, where does the ordinary Ghanaian stand? What are the implications of VAT 2.5% increment, E-levy threshold removal, and domestic debt exchange mean to the ordinary Ghanaian? Lansah Lawrence discusses.

Planning the family size could be a difficult topic to reach an agreement on between couples. Whereas there are many family planning methods for women, there are just a few for men. On the social aspect, should men care about proper family planning?
Ghana’s Finance Minister, Ken Ofori Atta has announced the government’s domestic debt exchange strategy. Do you understand what that means for individual investors?

On this week of Storytime with Nanz, there are loads of dilemmas to be solved. How would you deal with racism in your relationship? We explore the crucial role that fathers and father figures play in shaping the lives of young women as they transition into adulthood. From building self-esteem to teaching important life skills, fathers can provide a valuable source of guidance and support that can have a significant impact on their daughters' development.

In this video, we explore the contentious issue of whether women should be entitled to 50% of men's wealth after divorce. Divorce is a challenging time, and dividing assets can be a painful process. The law in many countries is such that assets acquired during a marriage are split 50/50. But is this fair?

In today's world, women are making significant strides in the corporate world, breaking through the glass ceiling and shattering stereotypes. However, there are still certain traits that women need to cultivate to succeed in this challenging environment. In this video, we will explore the top traits that women should have to excel in the corporate world.

Little by little the world’s population continues to reduce. There are lots of factors but one interesting cause is more women are shying from giving birth. What could be the cause? We discuss on the Ladies Avenue.

Are you planning an Easter picnic and wondering what to pack? In this video, we'll share the essential items that you should never leave out when packing for your picnic. From blankets and sunscreen to snacks and games, we've got you covered. We'll also provide some tips on how to pack everything efficiently so that you can have a stress-free and enjoyable picnic. So, whether you're going to the park, the beach, or your backyard, make sure to watch this video before you start packing. Happy Easter!

As women, our biological clock can often feel like a ticking time bomb, causing stress and anxiety about our future. On the Ladies Avenue, we discuss how to understand and deal with your biological clock, and provide tips for navigating your timeline with confidence. From family planning to career goals, we'll cover it all. Join the conversation and take control of your life today! Visit ghanatalksradio.con for more of our shows.
